TopicTitle: The Galileo Mission - Realistic Pictures from Jool

Articles.Content:
Hey guys!

**I recently attempted to launch a probe to research the full planetary system of Jool. Instead of sending 5 probes to their respective moons, I decided to send**

**one probe to make multiple flybys of the moons. (I was short on funds)**

**Here's the probe arriving at Jool.**

![Roc1P7c.png](http://i.imgur.com/Roc1P7c.png)

Thr probe was designed to carry all the science instruments to record data, and had about 3000m/s of delta-v. It didn't have a heat shield so it had to perform a rocket

burn to enter orbit around Jool.

The flyby's were happening in order as shown below:

**Laythe [First Flyby]**

The first flyby was Laythe, but i lost the pictures by accident ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I entered Laythe SOI at around 6km/s, and peaked at 8km/s, just barely scraping the atmosphere.

**Laythe [second Flyby]**

I lost pictures on the second flyby, but i was just barely inside Laythe's SOI, so i couldn't get high quality pictures.

The main objective of the second flyby was to achieve a gravity assist from Laythe to put me on course with Vall.

**Laythe [Third Flyby]**

The imaged from the third flyby of Laythe were lost as well. The third flyby helped to correct my inclination with respect to Vall.

**Vall [First Flyby]**

Finally, i had an encounter with Vall on the first flyby. I barely scraped the surface, avoiding tall mountains. Here are some shots i took while

in Vall SOI.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/bU9jW)

**Vall [second Flyby]**

I had another Flyby of Vall. The main objective of this flyby was to get a direct trajectory to Tylo using its gravity assist.

However, i had some sweet shots as well.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/l1oFG)

**Tylo [First Flyby]**

After an hour of planning ahead, i finally got to see Tylo. However, i didn't get anywhere close to its surface,

so i only had pixelated images. The gravity assist from Tylo swung me to the edge of Jool's SOI.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/AKkyA)

**Tylo [second Flyby]**

The second encounter was by chance, and a 1200m/s burn was performed to align me with Pol.

As i was out of fuel, the mission was over after Pol. Here are some chance pictures of Tylo on the second flyby.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/JVZcM)

**Pol [First Flyby]**

Out of fuel, the probe is unable to make huge corrections. But i was able to fly within 4km of the surface before bidding goodbye to the mission.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/XQuVo)

**The probe is now dead after a fruitful mission.**

**Jool observations**

Although the probe was constanly swinging by moons and avoiding space rocks, it was able to study the cloudy atmosphere of Jool.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/J2i8f)

I hope you enjoyed the presentation. If you really liked the pictures, feel free to use them in your forum posts!

![PAuFRvk.png](http://i.imgur.com/PAuFRvk.png)

A giant, floating paper ball.

These are nice! I'm not sure if I will or not, but would you mind if I used any of these in a video? I'm a fan of the style. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

>

Sure!

Feel free to use any of the photos above.
Where is the engine? It looks like it was cheated.
what mod did you use for taking Jools pics?

> 
> Where is the engine? It looks like it was cheated.

Engine's on the back. I'll post a few more pictures tomorrow ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> what mod did you use for taking Jools pics?

I actually screenshoted the planets and used photo editing tools to make it look realistic.

The Laythe is a lie! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Anyway, this looks really cool!
